Sections.Heading: Features
Sections.Content:
- 4* central Dresden hotel
- All excursions, entrance fees & guided tours included
- Three dinners included
- Direct scheduled British Airways flights from Heathrow to Berli
- Professional guide
- Executive coach (as detailed in the itinerary)
- Gratuities & audio headsets included

Sections.Heading: What We Will See
Sections.Content:
- Dresden – guided city walking tour
- Frauenkirche
- Zwinger Palace & Old Masters Picture Gallery – guided tour
- Pillnitz Castle, Gardens & the Museum of Decorative Arts – guided tour
- Paddle Steamer Cruise from Königstein to Pillnitz
- Royal Palace – Old Green Vault & New Green Vault
- Leipzig – guided city walking tour
- Tomaskirche
- Museum der Bildenden Künste – guided tour
- Meißen Porcelain Museum – guided tour

Sections.Heading: Accommodation
Sections.Content: We stay five nights at the centrally located 4* Maritim Hotel (www.maritim.de) in Dresden. Located by the River Elbe, and under a five minute walk from the Semper Opera House, facilities at the hotel include a restaurant, bar, swimming pool, gymnasium, steam room and a sauna. All rooms are en suite and feature television, telephone, hairdryer and a mini bar. Dinner is included in our hotel on the first and second evenings, and at a carefully selected restaurant which is a 10 minute walk from our hotel on the last night. The remaining two evenings are on bed and breakfast basis.

Sections.Heading: Extras To Your Tour
Sections.Content:
- Insurance £36
- Single room supplement £89
- Local accommodation tax to be paid directly to the hotel (approximately €1.30 per person per night)
- Flight details may be subject to change. Price based on twin share. Minimum numbers required. Normal booking conditions apply.

Sections.OriginalHeading: The Art & History of Dresden, Leipzig & Meiβen
Sections.Heading: The Art & History of Dresden, Leipzig & Meiβen
6 days from £994 Departing 29th September 2015

Sections.Content: Any air holidays and flights in this brochure are ATOL protected by the Civil Aviation Authority. Tailored Travel’s ATOL number is 5605

WHAT WE WILL SEE

Dresden – guided city walking tour Frauenkirche Zwinger Palace & Old Masters Picture Gallery Pillnitz Castle, Gardens & the Museum of Decorative Arts Paddle Steamer Cruise from Königstein to Pillnitz Royal Palace – Old Green Vault & New Green Vault Leipzig – guided city walking tour Tomaskirche Museum der Bildenden Künste Meißen Porcelain Museum

Dresden Pillnitz Palace

Meiβen Porcelain Museum
Surrey Heath DFAS presents

Sections.OriginalHeading: The Art & History of Dresden, Leipzig & Meiβen
Sections.Heading: The Art & History of Dresden, Leipzig & Meiβen
6 days from £994 Departing 29th September 2015
Sections.Content:
Day 1

We meet at Heathrow Airport for our direct scheduled British Airways flight to Berlin. On arrival in Berlin we are met by our guide and transfer by coach to the centrally located 4* Maritim Hotel in Dresden for a five night stay. Dinner is included in our hotel the first and second evenings, and at a carefully selected restaurant on the last night. The remaining two evenings are on bed and breakfast basis.

Day 2

This morning we enjoy a guided walking tour of Dresden, taking in sights such as the Semper Opera House and the Cathedral. During our guided tour we visit the Frauenkirche, an outstanding example of Protestant sacred architecture and featuring one of the largest domes in Europe. Destroyed during the bombing of Dresden in World War II, the church was rebuilt after the reunification of Dresden. This afternoon we walk to the Zwinger Palace, the old fortress of Dresden. A guided tour of the Old Masters Picture Gallery in the Palace introduces us to works by Rubens, Canaletto, Raphael, Titian, Rembrandt and Vermeer, as well as a wonderful Meiβen porcelain gallery.

Day 3

We visit Pillnitz Castle and Gardens for a morning guided tour. One of the area’s finest summer palaces, the Castle lies picturesquely on the banks of the River Elbe. With its flying buttresses and chimneys ornamented with crowns, this is the only Chinese style castle of its size in Europe. Here we visit the Museum of Decorative Arts. The museum focuses on Saxon and European arts and crafts of the 17th and 18th century. This afternoon we travel to Königstein, a town located by the banks of the River Elbe. We then take an included memorable paddle steamer cruise along the River Elbe from Königstein to Pirna to view the splendour of the Saxony Alps.

Day 4

This morning we visit the Royal Palace and visit the Old Green Vault with its collection of fine silver and jewellery followed by the New Green Vault highlighting some of the central pieces from the collection in their original setting including the celebrated Dresden Green Diamond. We then visit the New Green Vault. The rest of the day is at leisure in Dresden.

Day 5

Our guided walking tour of Leipzig this morning takes in sights such as the Opera House and the Nikolaikirche. We also visit the magnificent late-Gothic Tomaskirche, where Bach was the choirmaster from 1723. This afternoon we enjoy a guided tour at the Museum der Bildenden Künste, home to a fine collection of paintings by German masters from the late Middle Ages to the present day. Included are Lucas Cranach, Martin Schongauer, Caspar David Friedrich, Arnold Böcklin, Max Lieberman and Max Klinger. A farewell dinner is included at a carefully selected restaurant in Dresden this evening.

Day 6

A guided tour of the Meißen Porcelain Museum this morning gives an insight into the production process at this world renowned manufacturer. We return to Berlin Airport for our direct scheduled British Airways flight back Lacock to Heathrow. Abbey

NB:- Please note we reserve the right to alter the above itinerary if required for operational

reasons. Given the historic nature of the places visited, a certain degree of walking will be involved, and this holiday may not be suitable for those with mobility problems.

Sections.Heading: 22. Passports, Visas. Etc.
Sections.Content: It is your responsibility to ensure that you and those for whom you are booking are in possession of valid passports and any appropriate visas. Be sure to check passport and visa requirements with the consulates of countries being travelled through well in advance. You are responsible for any charges, fines etc, that may be levied by authorities in the UK or overseas for non compliance with regulations in the area and any such amounts will be recharged to you. You will not be permitted to travel overseas without an appropriate passport and all applicable visas. UK passports should be valid for at least 3 months beyond your planned date of return to the UK.

When you make a booking or enter into a transaction this means you consent to our passing on such details. We may be required to provide information by law as permitted by the Data Protection Act or by a legal authority recognised by the European Union. We will use the information you provide to send you details about our products and services now and in the future. We may also pass your details to third parties working on our behalf. If you do not want us to do this you must write to the Data Controller‚ at our head office address. We will not sell or pass your details to any individual or company which is not a subsidiary or parent of ours without your prior consent except in the circumstances shown above. Sections.Heading: 26. Your Financial Protection
Sections.Content:
reserve the right to do so. Most changes are minor. Occasionally, we

in total.

1. The air holidays and flights in the brochure are ATOL protected, since we hold an Air Travel Organiser's Licence granted by the Civil Aviation Authority. Our ATOL number is ATOL 5605. In the unlikely event of our insolvency, the CAA will ensure that you are not stranded abroad and will arrange to refund any money you have paid for an advance booking. For further information, visit the ATOL website at www.atol.org.uk. 2. When you buy an ATOL protected flight inclusive holiday from us you will receive an ATOL Certificate. This lists what is financially protected, where you can get information on what this means for you and who to contact if things go wrong. We will provide you with the services listed on the ATOL Certificate. In some cases, where we are unable to do so for reasons of insolvency, an alternative ATOL holder may provide you with the services you have bought or a suitable alternative (at no extra cost to you). You agree to accept that in those circumstances the alternative ATOL holder will perform those obligations and you agree to pay any money outstanding to be paid by you under your contract to that alternative ATOL holder. However, you also agree that in some cases it will not be possible to appoint an alternative ATOL holder, in which case you will be entitled to make a claim under the ATOL scheme (or your credit card issuer where applicable). 3. If we are unable to provide the services listed in your ATOL Certificate (or a suitable alternative, through an alternative ATOL holder or otherwise) for reasons of insolvency, the Trustees of the Air Travel Trust may make a payment to (or confer a benefit on) you under the ATOL scheme. You agree that in return for such a payment or benefit you assign absolutely to those Trustees any claims which you have or may have arising out of or relating to the non-provision of the services, including any claim against us, the travel agent (or your credit card issuer where applicable). You also agree that any such claims may be re-assigned to another body, if that other body has paid sums you have claimed under the ATOL scheme. 4. Your non ATOL financial protection is covered by a separate trust account administered by independent chartered accountants.
